pageContext.claim: “On obstruction. You mean on a no-crime. You mean there was no crime. So there was no crime taken and –”
pageContext.analysis: Obstruction of justice is a crime unto itself. Special counsel Robert Mueller did not find sufficient evidence to charge illegal coordination between the Trump campaign and Russia, but he did find several instances in which Trump potentially obstructed the investigation. Trump says there can be no obstruction if there was no illegal coordination to begin with, but that's wrong, as any criminal defense lawyer knows. Mueller said in his report that Trump may have had other reasons to obstruct justice, such as avoiding FBI scrutiny into unrelated aspects of his life and business dealings.
